website_summaries.verdict: Off road lights with a wider beam and light cast than small flood lights.
pros: The large and wide array of LED lights cast a good amount of illumination in front of the vehicle while remaining energy efficient
Can be mounted in a variety of locations on a vehicle
cons: The included wireless controller can have a spotty connection at times while driving

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly bright and easy to install!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I'm giving it a 5 stars..... RIGHT NOW!!! I've read that in the future they condensate, in hoping that's not the issue, but speaking as of right now, these things are incredible!!!! They look so good and are so bright, I'm very Happy! They fit PERFECTLY in the factory fog light holes for a 2003 to 2007 silverado.... I HIGHLY recommend these for the money.... NOW 6 months down the road will I still feel the same way, idk..... but I sure hope so!
customer_reviews.author: James Dean

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed! I want a new bracket
customer_reviews.text: Two weeks after installing on front bumper of my semi as fog lights, the thin aluminum bracket broke. After pulling the light off the bumper completely, I noticed there’s condensation inside. Very disappointed! I want a new bracket. The condensation I’ll figure out. But I want the light remounted. How do I contact the seller to get them to resend me a new bracket? Preferably steel. Not aluminum. But if aluminum is all you have, it’s better than nothing. Please contact me Nilight.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: I added these under the back bumper and they are awesome! Super bright and they look pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I have these on the back of my F-150 to turn on with the back-up lights. I have a backup camera but I can not see anything at night because the stock backup lights are too dim and they are too high off the ground to light up the road/driveway behind me. I added these under the back bumper and they are awesome! Super bright and they look pretty good. I might have purchased the smaller ones (in hindsight) simply for esthetic reasons, but I can't complain. I am thinking of ordering a couple more for the bed of the truck, under the tonneau cover, so I can see easily at night. I would definitely order again and would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: griff

customer_reviews.title: Great value - don't even think twice before buying it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really impressive set of lights. Small enough to place on an ATV or small off-road vehicle (even a riding lawnmower!) and bright enough to use in tandem with another (and it's spotlight companion) on a full-sized off-road vehicle. Seriously, people spend so much more money elsewhere to add this level of illumination to their vehicles, both on and off-road. This is, hands-down, the no-brain option to add more light to wherever you want it to be.
customer_reviews.author: The consumer's voice

customer_reviews.title: Chinese junk
customer_reviews.text: Looks great on all the pictures here right? Well notice the manufacturer never states the lumen output.. these look bright if you look directly at them But the actual light output is poor and puts about the same light in front as my led parking lights. Im going with rigid d2 lights Made in the usa. More expensive but you get what you pay for. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: doug dirusso

customer_reviews.title: The 54" curved is very bright and looks great
customer_reviews.text: I see a bunch of reviews but some don't say which size light. I tried this over a more expensive option and can say I'm very satisfied. I got the Rough Country windshield bracket to mount it on my 2006 F350 and it works with this bar. I ran it to my upfitter switch so didn't need the harness/wiring kit. It whistles something fierce on the highway but black automotive door edge trim on the bottom and top two fins got rid of it. The Rigid rubber isolator didn't work to stop noise on this bar. You still hear wind on the highway but it's not terrible.
customer_reviews.author: WNF

customer_reviews.title: Terrible to Install
customer_reviews.text: I just finished installing these on my pontoon boat, and I could not believe how difficult they were to install. The bracket is slightly too wide and the 4 bolts to mount the light to the bracket from the side are short and the machining threads into the light are not that good. It is particularly hard to install on the side of the light where the cord comes out. This should have been so simple and it was not. I will see how they work later on, but this is just bad engineering - and for no good reason.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Bug

customer_reviews.title: Died in 3 months UPDATED water in housing
customer_reviews.text: I installed it in February and it stopped working entirely in May. I will try customer service and see what they say..... UPDATE I wrote the customer service a email saying my light was not working. They responded to me in about 4 hours. After a couple emails back and forth they said they sent a replacement to me. UPDATE New light showed up and it works great. Changing my review to 3 stars. If it last till winter at least I'll change it again. UPDATE There is condensation in the light bar..........I'm over it.
customer_reviews.author: Pancho

customer_reviews.title: additional back up lights on my 2011 Tundra
customer_reviews.text: these are not crazy bright, they are perfect for additional back up lights on my 2011 Tundra. I added a relay and ran a power wire to the front fuse box. Then switched the relay with the back up lights. Plenty enough light to back into dark driveway. It also is enough to see trailer and where it is going. I mounted them under the bumper, angled out to the side just slightly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, get your own bolts
customer_reviews.text: Few months in, the light is great. Not super powerful like everyone claims, but it isn’t a knock-off brightness. Definitely a good amount of illumination. Took off a star because the mounting bolts are already rusting. Didn’t even think to check if they’re stainless steel, because they’re obviously not. Anything exposed to the elements needs to be galvanized or stainless, and these bolts are neither. Get you some stainless steel bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a great light I did put silicon around the edges and ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a great light I did put silicon around the edges and any where water could leak in. I drive a lot in rural areas and love the visibility I get with these lights.i may get a few more down the road. The first picture is of just my headlights the second is of my led lights with my headlights 2020 update I have used these lights for a few years now they still hold strong and I have not done anything to them. They are reliable and strong. It’s an amazing product I wish everything was this reliable
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Knuckles

customer_reviews.title: Light up my back yard. One odd problem
customer_reviews.text: I installed 4 of these on the skirt of my deck. We are really impressed at the light output. I hooked them up to a 24v power supply operated by an Alexa switch. An electrician wanted $300 more for AC floodlights with a wall switch than I paid for the complete set up. There is one odd problem however. We use an outdoor antenna for our TV. If the lights are on we lose ABC. I've tried a different power supply and installed a filter. It's the LED lights causing the interference. Our "fix" is to not turn the lights on while we watch ABC!
customer_reviews.author: Rich M

customer_reviews.title: Chinese made lights
customer_reviews.text: Have not mounted to my rear bumper yet. To save you a little time , all hardware is metric. Threads in brackets have a little too much paint in them or the bolts were not threaded correctly. Had to apply a little more pressure on wrench to get them put together. Will update after installation. Update: After getting these mounted, they put out a great amount of light. Much better than O.E.M. lamps. Would purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: kdub

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pair of "cheapie" L.E.D. lights.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pair of "cheapie" L.E.D. lights. Exactly what I hoped they would be. They appear well-made. Their fit and finish appears excellent. They should/will fit my need perfectly. I've installed them, but haven't wired them yet. Eager to see how they perform. I saw absolutely NO need for an expensive pair of this kind of light for my application (on my Craftsman lawn tractor). I just wanted a HUGE improvement over the OEM headlights on my tractor. They look GREAT, mounted on my tubular, OEM front bumper. They arrived promptly and on-time as promised, in appropriate packaging, undamaged. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Climer

customer_reviews.title: bow chicka bow wow,  these will do the trick!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely colorblind and these were a sinch to wire in. probably took me 1/2 an hour to wire into my 2011 dodge charger. I wired the 2 led spot lights in the grill of the charger to give it that authentic cop car look, nothing says get out of the fast lane like a retired police edition white charger with cop looking lights in the grill and a dude wearing aviators behind the wheel. note: i have to admit these actions are quasi illegal so please do not replicate at home please. Lights are not as bright as i thought they would be but heck for the price i really cant cry...too much.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ruehlen

customer_reviews.title: Use caution tightening the bolts.
customer_reviews.text: I had these kicking around nearly 2-years. Decided today was it, so I installed them on my truck. First thing I discovered was the nuts, bolts, and washers were aluminum. Second discovery was hand tightening one of the bolts caused it to strip the threads in the light. Made it work with thread sealant. A little shocked how easily 1 hole gave out. 1 in 8 is not too terrible I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Zed Z. Zed

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: The lights work ok if placed on the front of your vehicle. Mounted above the cab, or on the hood causes too much projection off of the vehicle, giving a blizzard affect. They worked ok. For 6 months. One is blinking now. Something inside the light is failing. Blink while driving and while parked. Should be able to get more than 6 months use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the look!
customer_reviews.text: Received on time and as described. I really like the look of the black housing. It's almost unnoticeable behind the grille as compared to the other light bar in the lower grille. Wiring is simple. I had to make my own custom brackets to mount it behind the grille which is no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works great, easy install
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my Harley as an auxiliary light under the top triple tree. It fits great between the forks and mounted right up under the headlight. I already had an auxiliary switch wired in so it was easy to tap in to that for power. This little light really adds to my night vision. It’s like having an extra bright on a dark road. Looks great and works great!
customer_reviews.author: David Harris

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be of good quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for auxiliary reverse lights(a little overkill). They work GREAT!!! Do yourself a favor and just check the tightness of the screws that hold the case together. When I was reading the reviews I saw a lot of complaints about moisture getting inside. When I got them I could see there's a rubber gasket inside and there were a few screws on each light that were a little loose. DO NOT OVERTIGHTEN!!! They have been installed since before winter and I have had no issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Rapp-Blaney

customer_reviews.title: These 2 light are great! My high beam just were not cutting it ...
customer_reviews.text: These 2 light are great! My high beam just were not cutting it on the back roads where all the deer hang out. These have a wide beam but remember these are "flood" lights NOT "Spot" lights. I may add 1 additional light in the center of my set up to cast more light further up the road later. I bought this in conjunction with the Lamphus 12v 40a wiring harness kit with switch. The switch gives a nice blue light when the system is on and is very easy to use. I also added an inline fuse too.
customer_reviews.author: Lira Z

customer_reviews.title: One light Crapped out ALREADY
customer_reviews.text: Bought these lights for my boyfriend as a Christmas present in Dec 2019. He loved them. One of the lights decided to go out last month, but it has a 2 year warranty. I contacted the company directly and they have not replied and it has been almost 2 weeks. I tried calling their phone number but it doesn't work. Why have a warranty on lights that go out in less than a year if the customer service team cannot reply to emails or have a working number. What a joke. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Pace

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit for Hammerhead GTS150
customer_reviews.text: I used these to replace the OEM lights on a Hammerhead GTS150. These were less expensive and provide better light. I decided to solder the original harness connector to the new lights for a nice finished look. By inserting a small shim between the bracket and the light housing to increase the clearance I was able to use the original mounting brackets on the kart. It is like they were made for it. They look great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Lights & easy to install if You let your canine buddy help you
customer_reviews.text: I Really like these lights. The 4 inch version look a little wimpy versus these. Really bright which I love. The best feature is they work with existing bumper bolts so you don’t have to drill any holes in the bumper. It Took me about five hours to install because I do it right. I made all my own custom harnesses and install the relay inside the left tail light lens and spliced into the back up circuit. Ran power from the battery fused and shrink-wrapped call wires. Works fantastic. Duration to be determined.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great lights, huge flood, Quality looking build.
customer_reviews.text: Installed these in place of my stock fog lights in my 2007 silverado nbs. Fit was tight but they look perfect in there. They are very bright with a huge flood area. I might of preferred a little bit more of a focused beam pattern, and I knew these were flood but seems less bright on the road since the light is just everywhere instead of semi focused. These would be perfect as auxiliary reverse lights. We'll see how they hold up. As long as they keep watertight I'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Travis H

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for with Nilights...
customer_reviews.text: You certainly get what you pay for with these lights. Great price, but after several months, they start chipping paint off and the fogging up some. There seems to be a bug in one of the lights, and that sure doesn't bode well for them. They are pretty bright and cheap though. Oh, and I bought three different sets for my Jeep, and one of them just started coming on driving down the road on its own. I'm thinking it may be a bad switch with the wiring harness kits, but I haven't established that yet (had to pull the fuse to be legal).
customer_reviews.author: Adam Keele

customer_reviews.title: Bright light with many uses
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set I have purchased. My first set went on my Polaris Ranger over a year ago and work great and are very bright. I just got a new riding mower and the LED headlights on it are not that bright. I spliced one of these lights to the wiring to the headlights on the mower and mounted it on the front bumper. Works great, now my neighbors are not thrilled that I can now mow all night long. The other light will be used on my Polaris as a rear light.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Heinous quality
customer_reviews.text: The day it arrived I installed it, and right out of the box the entire middle section doesn’t work. I understand I’m not buying super high quality but regardless they should at least work 100% for a little while. I’ll be getting a replacement but I don’t have great confidence in what will arrive next week. I also hate the hassle of having to deal with shipping it back. Update: just received the replacement, exact same problem. This is crap quality. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Frankdaycastle

customer_reviews.title: These lights are great for off roading at lower speeds
customer_reviews.text: These lights are great for off roading at lower speeds, just be aware that they are flood lights, not spot. I put them on my truck in hopes of being able to see deer at night on country roads, but they don't project far enough out for that. I just put a Nilight 23" triple row on the front of my truck that has both spot and flood. I think that will do the trick. I put one of the originals on the front of my camper and hooked it to my regualr porch light wiring, the other one is going to go on my Honda Foreman real soon.
customer_reviews.author: Dragfan

customer_reviews.title: Great lighting for illuminating around vehicle.
customer_reviews.text: I have these mounted on the back of my work vehicle and they have been thru some tough weather the past 5 months. They made it through snow, Covered in ice and horrible heavy rains. They are still working great and no signs of moisture inside of the housing. My termination connections are inside of the vehicle in waterproof connections with electrical silicone grease. I have been very happy. I have approx 20-25 hours of use on the lights and they are still holding just a strong.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and they are bright
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my Kubota cab tractor to replace front and rear work lights. These lights seem to be a great value and give off excellent bright white light. I will report back if I notice any water intrusion. So far there are great but one minor issue is that I was shorted one of the bolts that attach the mounting bracket to the light. I did not contact the seller.
customer_reviews.author: RoadmasterD

customer_reviews.title: stay away
customer_reviews.text: bought 2 pairs of these and installed on truck. first rain they went out, all 4. condensation inside lens. one of them now glows with the ferocity of a smashed firefly.
customer_reviews.author: tater

customer_reviews.title: Bright!
customer_reviews.text: I really like them they are bright dont get me wrong but they dont focus and project the beam of light. Its just everywhere, amd its a white light that's only really useful when it pitch black dark. Had them for a few months now been in all kinds of weather and they've held up so far. The mounting of the light itself to the mounting bracket is unnecessarily complicated. It's pose to make it adjustable I guess its just too much really imo
customer_reviews.author: S.E.Wells

customer_reviews.title: Super bright - low amps - great price
customer_reviews.text: Bright as hell - installed these on fabricated magnetic bases and stuck them on the snowblower unit on my JD Tractor. The stock lights are low and well, simply light up the snowblower attachment so having the bright light in front will make those late night snowblowing trips much easier. I may attach some metal to the hood of the tractor and use them in the summer months also.
customer_reviews.author: nh_handyman

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and short lived.
customer_reviews.text: Less than 6 months on my car used occasionally when absolutely needed in stormy weather and 3 LEDs burnt out... that lamp also has moisture inside. So much for long life!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pete 2Z

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Light bar works well. Uploaded a picture of span of light. Only images I could find were of the actual light bar on whatever it was mounted to, not of the area lit up by the light bar. Hopefully this will help some in their decision for this light bar. Due to location the light bar only illuminates forward area but I will be placing side lights in the near future to help see the mower deck.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Light Bar
customer_reviews.text: Great light bar! Very bright for what it is and so far no water leaks at all. I've let it sit through a few downpours and regularly go through a automatic car wash with zero issues. Highly Recommend. I will update if i have any issues down the road. Only issue I had was with TERRIBLE amazon warehouse packaging since I bought it used. Was just shoved in a box with no padding at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: I ordered four of these lights for my Jeep - 2 for the rear and one for each side of the vehicle. The light output is very impressive. We used these lights for setting up our campsite in the dark almost every night of a 9-day road trip, and couldn't have asked for more. The only issue is that two of the lights show water inside, almost immediately after installation. I waited 9 months to install them so I can't get them exchanged, but I would still highly recommend these lights.
customer_reviews.author: e46fanatic

customer_reviews.title: If you need to Light to see you; You will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and really Bright to light the way in the dark. Draws unnoticeable amps for the light they put out. Built strong and not out of plastic and very durable. I have 2 sets. ! set on the front of my Trailblazer mounted on Bull Bar and the other set on the back for brighter backup lights. They are Hard wired in to come on when I put it in reverse. Awesome addition to my ride in Looks and Work-ability. In Other word "I can See" Mount tight and do not shimmy or shake as you are driving either. Highly Recommend and would buy again when the time comes to do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L. Tillis

customer_reviews.title: Carotid relay
customer_reviews.text: I can not find a way to get ahold of this company to talk to them about this issue. I have had my lights on my car for not even 3 months and the relay is completely carotid. I love how bright these lights are but I tried turning them on and they were barley on and flickering and we found that issue. Would like it if the company would do something about this because I can’t even turn on my lights now.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous overall illumination!  Wide and deep illuminated area.
customer_reviews.text: These babies light up the night like crazy! They don't have a 'beam' like a conventional headlight, so you end up with a larger field of illumination. As a result, the illuminated area is much wider and deeper than with conventional lights. And the current draw is much less than comparable filament lights. Well worth the investment! I may buy more and find something to put them on!!
customer_reviews.author: TH3298

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Purchase!! BRIGHT!!
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought a set for my golf cart in October. ( posted a review then also). I was impressed enough that I bought another set for my fishing pontoon. These replace a set of 75 watt LED's. They light up the lake and the dock. They work great. Look good for a old pontoon. I'm curious on the longevity being exposed to a lake, the summer heat, etc. I'll report back later this summer for how they held up. Easy to install and wire in. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Houseplant

customer_reviews.title: Cracked
customer_reviews.text: Had installed in my truck two weeks right front lines cracked reached out no reply sadly disappointed would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Claude

customer_reviews.title: Lights up the night
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use the included brackets because I wanted a below roof mount to keep tree limbs from possibly damaging it or ripping it off the roof. Beware the mounts you select because the ones I picked out won't allow a full windshield but that's my fault for not researching that. The light really throws out plenty but I just got it installed and will update later if I have problems.
customer_reviews.author: Numb

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It works and is bright! I couldn't get the mounting hardware on the two opposing sides to sit flush on a flat surface. You can adjust each side independently, but it seems the teeth were off just a little on one side or the other so it overshot the other side whichever way I moved it.
customer_reviews.author: Wildbunch

customer_reviews.title: Lights worked great at the house
customer_reviews.text: Installed these lights on a ATV for a 2 week Mule deer hunt in Texas. Lights worked great at the house. But I only drove around my backyard for a few minutes. They were working good and very bright. After towing the ATV 500 plus miles for the hunting trip they went out the first morning as soon as we took off. I tested the lights and getting 12V but nothing. They both stopped working. I checked polarity, it is correct and checked voltage and they are well within the advertised operating range. At idle around 14V and when the motor revs up around 18V. No sure why they stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Waguese

customer_reviews.title: Nothing amazing but a good cheap light.
customer_reviews.text: My 6x4 gator had two bad headlight bulbs and one broken lense. That together would have been about $100 so I replaced the headlights completely with these. With some slight modification to the gator, they work great and make more light than the originals. They seem reasonably well made and the mounting hardware is very good. All around, I like these and would buy them again assuming they last a decently long time. If problems arise, I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Bright with Good Beam pattern and nice construction
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality and really bright. I mounted one of these to the front of my son's Razor electric dirt bike and tied it into the 12v battery string along with a handlebar switch. Lets him ride around at night with very good visibility and low current draw - this light combined with front and rear blinking LEDs for safety all tied into the same circuit don't even blow a 5A fuse. He loves his new lights.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool but makes horrible sound
customer_reviews.text: The 32” curved black light bar looks very cool. And is very bright. But I absolutely am not satisfied with it. I wired it to my fuse box. With its own fuse. And when I turn it on it sqweels at a very high pitch. Would look at maybe getting a different brand or higher quality. I have usually had good luck with this company and have always bought their products until I came across this one. Best of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Braun

customer_reviews.title: Not weatherproof
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use as fog lights for my Jeep and mounted them in the same spot as the stock ones. Have only had them for a few months and after the most recent rainfall one of them has now gone out and has water inside the light itself. Also had the same issue with the 52" curved lightbar I got but it didn't go out when it got water in it from the rain.
customer_reviews.author: H Silent

customer_reviews.title: For a good time call 867-5309
customer_reviews.text: They're not real expensive but they put out a good amount of light I tend to buy cheaper lights cuz if I bust them or something happens I'm not worried about expensive lights I pull it off and pop a new one but let's be honest no one really reads these reviews anyway
customer_reviews.author: John A Farris

customer_reviews.title: Great light!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great overall quality. The black surround for the reflective light cups really sets this light bar apart from others. Heavy duty power cable extends from housing. It lights up the entire street.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mchugh

customer_reviews.title: Very bright lights.
customer_reviews.text: My husband installed these on his car trailer so he can have some powerful backup lights when backing at night. They are bright day or night. Lights up the entire area behind the trailer to make backing much easier. They could work on any vehicle where you need extra lighting. These are not driving lights because they would definitely blind an oncoming driver but would be great for off road night driving.
customer_reviews.author: debbie700

customer_reviews.title: they are very bright and are great for night fishing but i wish they were better ...
customer_reviews.text: I now have had these lights 7 months and they are ok because they are not truly waterproof . I have them on my boat and for the last 3 months i have keep them out of the elements because they build up condensation on the inside of the glass. and now i have to replace 1 of them . they are very bright and are great for night fishing but i wish they were better at keeping the water out
customer_reviews.author: Boomer Woliver

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with Nilight
customer_reviews.text: Extremely bright light bar. All my led lights are Nilight and I’ve had no issues with any of them. I have the 54” light bar and 2 led lights I’ve installed in my rear bumper for extra light when I’m in reverse and all are very bright.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: There is no left or right light, they are identical.
customer_reviews.text: Lights arrived with no outer packaging and a funny tinkle inside. On opening the box they were not damaged. They perfectly replaced the OEM lights. The units are brighter than the originals and look good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used for several months, bright and no issues
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these because my factory headlights stink on low beam. Mounted in front tag bolt holes. Brackets are adjustable and we're slide to each side so mounted side by side . I aimed them lower as not to bother oncoming traffic. Give great view of the sides of the road. We have lots of wild life that walk edge of roads and are hard to see until you are on top of them. These really helped.
customer_reviews.author: Master tinkerer

customer_reviews.title: Super deal
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with these lights. Very bright White light typical of LED lighting. Quality seems very good for the price. Water is what distroys most fog/driving lights So time will tell. ..I think I'm going to order a couple more sets for my tractor Great deal I think The super thing about LED lighting is they hardly use any amps ...so you can use regular wiring and no relay for most apps
customer_reviews.author: Raggityman

customer_reviews.title: Quality light bar for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have this on a Side by Side “RZR” and it does a good job. It is fairly bright, not insanely bright. So far I haven’t noticed any condensation or moisture inside the housing. I would definitely buy it again or purchase a different one for the sole purpose brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Connor s.

customer_reviews.title: Sweet light, poor shipment packaging
customer_reviews.text: The light works great however the shipment was packed like trash. Not only that when I reviewed this Amazon removed my review with photos of the shipment. They lot a lot of respect on my end. Almost returned it just because of that.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Super bright!
customer_reviews.text: I attached these to the front of my grill guard on my truck and bought a wiring kit to easily install them. if you are looking for something that will brighten up your surroundings, this is perfect, but if you want something that helps see further in the distance, you may want to try something else (or buy better high beams).
customer_reviews.author: Jay Desmarais

customer_reviews.title: Great choice, simple install and very bright.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly bright and very easy to install with separate wiring harness. I installed on my 2016 Kodiak 700. Ordered proper bar clamps to mount for hardware and additional harness with switch. Total with lights was cheaper than most set ups just the lights!. I plan to use for plowing as well as help setting up decoys over fields for waterfowl.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Love my new LED driving lights!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 20 inch light bar and 2 of the 7 inch for driving lights! Easy installation and looks great!! Really lights up the road for me! 1st pic is just Headlights, 2nd pic is Headlights and 7 inch LED driving lights and the 3rd pic is 20 inch LED light Bar 7 inch LED driving lights with regular headlights! Installed on my 2002 Ford Excursion! Will be adding the 54” light bar soon! Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.author: John Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great backup lights for the camper!
customer_reviews.text: I needed light for backing into the driveway and campsites at night. These were perfect for just that duty. They are very bright and appear to be fairly sturdy for what I needed them for. I have them angled outward to light up the sides of the camper. Wiring it up was easy. Time will tell if they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: saxophone boy

customer_reviews.title: Not properly sealed
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these on the back of my Jeep for about 6 months. One of them is just fine, but the other clearly has a problem with its seal. There's no way this is truly IP67 rated - there's so much moisture in here, mold has started to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lights!
customer_reviews.text: These things are bright! Bought two pairs to put on the four wheelers but ended up using a set on our riding lawn mower too! These things light up the yard way better than any tractor headlight. I highly recommend these for pretty much any use. The lights are a very bright white, the mounting isn't too difficult and all the hardware was included. After a while I'll update this review with more data, as they haven't been on long enough to know their long term durability yet.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great light bar, super bright.
customer_reviews.text: So I installed the 32" Curved bar in the lower grill of my F150 about 3 years ago, BUT I read the reviews first so as soon as i got it i removed the end caps on both sides and shot the edges of the glass full of clear silicone caulking. This bar is tough, i even rear ended someone in my truck and the bar still works fine lol. All of the LED's still work, and i have zero moisture inside the fixture. takes 10 minutes to water proof this thing and it'll last you years. I wouldn't hesitate to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: These have a fantastic flood pattern. I will be using them as ramp loading lights for my enclosed trailer. The factory LED loading lights are a joke compared to these lights. Here are some not-so-glamorous photos but it's a decent representation of the output. FYI: The lights are angled down at @ 45°
customer_reviews.author: BattlePhrog

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: This is a pair of FLOOD lights. Not spot driving lights. I have a smaller set that brightens road/ trail much further down the way. Make sure you know what you are buying. Product is fine, just not directional.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very bright lights and easy wiring and mounting. I have been purchasing your products for a long time and had no issues, however this one time one mounting block was missing. the one from the other light is shown in picture. Can you please send me a replacement without having to return everything...just the block that allows the other connections to be made. Thank you and please advise, your product are great and catching on.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Work great on my 2008 F250
customer_reviews.text: The lights are fantastic for the price. Not cheap at all. I put these under the rear bumper with a simple L angle iron that has all the holes on it. Super easy to find at a home Depot or tractor supply. I wired them together on the same Auxiliary switch. The lights give plenty of area to back up safely at night
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice bright lights
customer_reviews.text: Installed these are rear work lights on my tractor. They beat what comes stock and you have to pay a lot more for the stock ones. I wasn't sure what size to get and probably went larger than needed. But then, more is usually better. I had considered a 24" light bar, but these do just fine. Very happy with the result.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: One fogged up in 1 week!
customer_reviews.text: I installed these as reverse lights on RV trailer, one week after installing them one of fogged up. In that week the trailer had not even moved. Other than the lens seals needing improvement they are good lights for the price.
customer_reviews.author: 440justin

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty not all tin and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Seems legit I’m using them as extra bright reverse lights
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Missing Brackets
customer_reviews.text: Only the light came in the box. No brackets like the description says. I go to my orders, and there is not an option to contact the seller. Only an option to return. I don't want to return. I just want to ask for the brackets and screws. Gee thanks Nilight and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: ego

customer_reviews.title: Wow this thing is bright
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with it, seems to be great quality and comes with all necessary hardware. YOU WILL NEED TO BUY A WIRING KIT AND SWITCH, it doesn't include that.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan V

customer_reviews.title: Good Lights
customer_reviews.text: For the price NiLight products are hard to beat. I usually end up with moisture behind the lens when I purchased their lights a long time ago. Since then I just add a little silicone around the glass, bolts, and housing seal and they never get moisture then. Very bright for how inexpensive they are.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Very bright, ended up ordering more
customer_reviews.text: Man these things are bright. It’s a great way to attract all those little bugs that want tickle your untrimmed nose hairs. 10/10 spiders would recommend building a web near this bad boy.
customer_reviews.author: Debdemp

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet installed these lights, but I am amazed at the solid quality of the housing. Great value for not that much money. I'll update after installing.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Bright
customer_reviews.text: The NiLight 36W floodlights made in china are very bright. They have a good solid mounting structure. I mounted these on the front of my boat and it really lights up the water. Typically the water absorbs lights and makes it hard to see with past front flood lights. These units light up so well people on the docks almost complain about the brightness. The range is about 100 yards.
customer_reviews.author: George Stoltz

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy mounting bracket
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to put on my Kubota RTV X1100C. Lights work like they are suppose to, but don’t buy these if you plan on spending any time in the brush, the mounts won’t handel it.
customer_reviews.author: EDWARD P SEGAR

customer_reviews.title: Very very happy with them
customer_reviews.text: Working better than expected,but I did take it apart and put gaskets everywhere to make sure it to prevent water getting in. I had about 16 of them on my big truck and within about 2 years only 3 died but 1 was completely under water once and I've done about 200k miles all over the country with them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BRIGHT FLOODS !!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I JUST INSTALLED THESE 6.5" LEDs ON MY 2010 RUBI UNLIMITED .VERY NICE BRIGHT FLOODS FOR SIDE LIGHTING .I ALSO BOUHT AN AFTERMARKET WIRING HARNESS FOR THE APPILCATION. THESE LITTLE FLOODS ARE BRIGHTER THAN MY AFTERMARKET HALOGEN HEADLIGHTS !!!!! FOR THE PRICE " "IF" THEY WEAR OUT I CAN BUY ANOTHER PAIR AND STILL COME OUT AHEAD ON THE PRICE COMPARED TO THE "INDUSTRY STANDARDS" (R/I , B/OAK ETC.....) THE WIREING IS SIMPLE JUST MAKE SURE WHERE YOU MOUNT THEM YOU CAN CONCEAL THE JUCTION TO THE HARNESS , THE WIRE COMING FROM THE LITE IS APPROX 8-10" LONG, USE SHRINK WRAP ON YOUR JUCNTIONS
customer_reviews.author: M 240 B DAD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and are very bright. This is a spot type beam so be sure that is what you'd like. I'm using them as front off road lights and for the rear I did purchase flood lights for more of a surface coverage. I did purchase a wiring harness and in total installation took me about an hour since I try to properly hide and run my cables and with simple clamp on connectors your have these lights working in no time.
customer_reviews.author: RojoMojoRisin

customer_reviews.title: Great for the woods!
customer_reviews.text: Really bright light bar. Installed on my 17 rzr 900s. It would have mounted perfect between the factory roll cage gussets with correct mounts but I have an aftermarket roof and full fold down windshield. I couldn't mount it exactly where I wanted it because of the windshield so I put it on the roof but as far the quality of the light bar and the brightness I'm very please with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie Brunner

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Puts out good light, would like it better if it were more directed ahead, it kinda doesn't shine as far as you'd think. There's a lot of wasted light in the sky and on the ground. Lens filled with water in rain the first week, I was going to return it, but figured it wasn't worth the effort. It doesn't do it anymore so I guess it's ok?
customer_reviews.author: Louis M.

customer_reviews.title: Bright and compact .  Not DOT approved
customer_reviews.text: They do not come with a wiring harness so be aware of that. Very bright and very white. Be ready for lots of headlight flashes if you dont have a way to shut them off .
customer_reviews.author: philip r barstow

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product, good at first but now has water inside.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money, water will get inside them. They didn't make it past the first couple of months of winter (California winters are far from harsh) Before the lenses started to fog up with water inside and now one of them has stoped working completely.
customer_reviews.author: M. Neff

customer_reviews.title: Work. Not bright.
customer_reviews.text: These fit the need I bought them for which is illuminating turns off road at night. For that they worked great. They are not very bright though. Imagine old incandescent headlights. They do what they are supposed to do and seem of decent quality. Wish they were about twice as bright.
customer_reviews.author: JBrookie

customer_reviews.title: Great lights but the mounts suck
customer_reviews.text: Great lights but the mounts suck! They keep loosening up on truck. I have lost 4 bolts so far and this is just from average driving on flat paved roads and highways. no off road or bumpy back roads. Would highly recommend lock washers AND loctite!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Flood EVERYWHERE even pointed away & down...
customer_reviews.text: Flood is right! I put one on my truck for driving/fog. I don't want to blind other drivers and had to almost point them far to the right and down they are so bright and scatter so much. They flood up and to the sides BIG TIME, they need side/top shields sticking out to not scatter so much.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Diver

customer_reviews.title: Best freaking light bar ever
customer_reviews.text: This light bar is the bees knees. No need to pay $400 for a ‘top of the line’ bar! This will do it! Make sure to get the B model which is the updated version
customer_reviews.author: Fly With Beck

customer_reviews.title: Nice but leak.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these finally installed them 6 months later. They were bright nice lights got a lot of compliments. Just looked at them today 1 is still okay the other one has water. 2 months installed leaks already??? Says a 2 year warranty?
customer_reviews.author: jt

customer_reviews.title: I give them 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these roof mounted on an off road vehicle. They are just about 2 years old now and have been used allot. Probably at least 60hrs of use. One of them has just decided to stop working. If i tap on it then it will come on and work but also making a high pitch ringing noise. The other one is still working just as good as new. I would add that they have been exposed to both below freezing and above 110 degree temperatures and allot off vibration offroad.
customer_reviews.author: maverek

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work terrible experience
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this I bought a whole wiring kit with brackets to mount on my truck then I mounted the bar well turned out it didn’t work and I had stripped on of the cheap Chinese garbage mounting bolts so I couldn’t get it off and spent about 3 hours trying to get the bolt out of the bar then when I had finally got it off I had practically ruined my mounting brackets terrible experience
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: poor quality , unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: all good! BUT it’s not waterproofed 😒 3 led are dead! and the second light is totally lost after few rains 😒
customer_reviews.author: N B

customer_reviews.title: This is a SPOT not a Flood as the description states
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this light because it stated it was a FLOOD light, it is not. per the literature supplied with the light and after installation it is definitely a SPOT light.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Janett

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Very bright!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these awesome lights, especially for the price. Might even be a tad over kill for my application. So far they have been through rain, heat, cold, and washed, all without leaking or condensation. Went throughout both lights and had to snug down most of the screws. One thing I have noticed that even when tightened down, the light housing still wiggles on the up-down / right-left (depending on orientation) adjuster.
customer_reviews.author: G.E buyer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lights! super bright!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic lights! mounts are pretty durable and give you a wide range for adjustment, used them in the driving light holes on my 2000 silverado truck, love them for low beam driving lights with my normal lights you can really see the road great and clear and they dont blind other drivers! great product!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Great Zombie Lights!!
customer_reviews.text: These lights are bright and well made. I live in AZ, so I pretty much light up the desert, no problems with moisture here. I have them mounted on my Jeep, and hooked up to a "zombie lights" switch. I am very happy, and zombie free with these lights.
customer_reviews.author: azglenh

product_meta.title: Nilight Led Light Bar 2PCS 36w 6.5Inch Flood Led Off Road Lights Super Bright Driving Fog Light Boat Lights Driving Lights Led Work Light SUV Jeep Lamp,2 Years Warranty
product_meta.description: Size:2PCS 6.5" 36w Flood Light BarSpecification: LED Power: 36W (12 x 3W High Intensity LED) Beam Pattern: Flood Beam Input Voltage: 9-30V DC (fits 12V, 24V vehicles) Working Lifespan: Over 30, 000 hours Working Temperature: -40~85 degrees Celsius LED Color Temperature: Pure White 6000K-6500K Material: 6063 Aluminum Profile, High quality Led Chips, PC Lens Waterproof Rate: IP67; Waterproof, dustproof, quakeproof and anti-corrosive. Certifications: CE, FCC and RoHS Applications: Off Road Lighting: Jeeps, 4x4, Cars, Motorcycles, ATV, UTV, SUV, Truck, Trailer, Forklift, Trains, Boat, Bus, Road Buggy, Sand Rail, etc. Other Lighting: Excavator, Dozer, Road Roller, Crane, Tractor, Harvester, Grain Drill, Mower, Snowplow, Fire engine, Rescue Vehicle, Camping, Mining, Construction Lighting, etc. Household Lighting: Garden, Backyard, Garage, Indoor Lighting. (Note: Use a voltage transformer/converter to convert the AC 110-120V to DC 12V for indoor use. ) Note: They are aftermarket parts. NOT D. O. T. approved. Do not use if D. O. T. is required. For off road use only. Before installing this product, please check your state/provincial and local/municipal laws and regulations.
feature_bullets: SUPER BEIGHT LIGHT: High-quality LED chips emit bright white light to dispel darkness and make your trip safer.
WIDE ILLUMINATION RANGE: The reflector cups produce flood beam for wide view area, you can see the left and right clearly.
ADJUSTABLE MOUNTING BRACKET: The pod can be adjusted to about 45 degrees, which makes changing direction of light beam easier.
EFFECTIVE PROTECTION: IP67 waterproof rate, can effectively resist water and dust, avoiding moisture and condensation. Working life: 30000 hours
PACKAGE INCLUDE: 2PCS 36W LED Light Bars and Mounting Brackets

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,489 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
